Title: [ANN][ICO] PolicyPal Network - Future of Insurance for Unbanked and Cryptoassets
Body: Recap: PolicyPal Network at the Singapore-Korea ICT Symposium 2018 (13 July 2018) https://medium.com/@policypalnet/recap-policypal-network-at-the-singapore-korea-ict-symposium-2018-13-july-2018-25b3aa0e0745    PolicyPal Singapore and PolicyPal Network CEO and founder Val Yap was invited this year to be attend the Singapore-Korea ICT Symposium as a keynote speaker.  Jointly organised by SGTech, the Korea Ministry of Science and ICT, and the Korea National IT Industry Promotion Agency, the symposium this year was held at the Intercontinental Hotel Singapore.  The symposium brought together esteemed leaders in the respective industries to share ideas about the development of blockchain technology.  Val took to the stage to speak about “Security Opportunities for a Smart Nation”, where she spoke about how PolicyPal Network is making use of blockchain to innovate in the insurance industry.  Reiterating the importance of security, she said: “With more people getting into cryptocurrency space, one of the biggest challenges faced is crypto exchanges getting hacked.”  While there had been previously no coverage in the crypto asset space, PolicyPal Network is looking to provide cyber security coverage through CryptoProtect.  CryptoProtect is distributed by PolicyPal Singapore and underwritten by “AA” rated global insurers that provides protection for crypto assets like digital wallets, tokens and exchanges.  To identify threats online, PolicyPal Network is also working with Sentinel Protocol, a crowdsourced threat intelligence platform to protect individuals against hacks, scams and frauds. They employ a blockchain-based Threat Reputation Database to track and detect cybercrime data and threats.

Title: [ANN][ICO] PolicyPal Network - Future of Insurance for Unbanked and Cryptoassets
Body: Hi there, I've read that you guys are planning to adopt the dpos consensus model, are there worrirs over sybil attacks? How can we trust a network that relies on voters delegating (trusting) a few nodes to keep it running honestly?  That’s definitely a concern and we have thought about it.  There are 2 ways to stop that - 1) by making it very expensive in terms of gas fees and resources to deter people from acting maliciously. 2) Our partners in emerging countries will play a pivotal role in the delegate process as well, which will be elaborated further in the whitepaper.  Hi Everyone,  Welcome to PolicyPal Network - The Future of Insurance for Unbanked and Cryptoassets.  www.PolicyPal.network  PolicyPal Network is a platform built with a twofold vision of addressing key issues that overlap the fields of both insurance and cryptoassets in the world today. Body: Some quick checks that I have done on Policypal Network as follows:  - Policypal is the first to graduate from Monetary Authority of Singapore(MAS) sandbox. Singapore is known for its strict law and regulations. The Monetary Authority of Singapore (Abbreviation: MAS; Chinese: 新加坡金融管理局; Malay: Penguasa Kewangan Singapura) is Singapore's central bank and financial regulatory authority. So in order for Policypal to be able to be recognized by MAS, it has to go through strict regulations and supported with a history of past achievements.  - Policypal Network is being incubated by Paypal. One other ICO that is also under the Paypal incubation is TenX.  - Policypal has a huge network with some of its partners to be AIG, Aviva, AXA, Etiqa and NTUC incomes.  - CEO Val Yap is listed as Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia.
